bio.singa.mathematics.vectors

Class RegularVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.mathematics.vectors.RegularVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Addable<Vector>, AdditivelyInvertible<Vector>, Divisible<Vector>, Invertible<Vector>, MultiDimensional<Vector>, Multipliable<Vector>, Ring<Vector>, Subtractable<Vector>, Metrizable<Vector>, Transformable<Vector>, Vector
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Vector2D

    public class RegularVector
extends java.lang.Object
implements Vector
    The RegularVector class handles the general properties and operations of vectors. A vector is a composition of elements (double values) that specify the position of a point in a multidimensional topology.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new vector with the given elements.

      • dyadicProduct

        public RegularMatrix dyadicProduct(Vector vector)
        Description copied from interface: Vector
        The numerical components of vectors can be arranged into row and column vectors. The dyadic product returns a matrix, where the element (i,j) is obtained by multiplying the i'th element of this vector with the j'th element of the other vector.
        Specified by:
        dyadicProduct in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - Another vector of the same dimension.
        Returns:
        The matrix of the dyadic product
